definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: These two contestations supplement each other, and they are the way to build our native modernity.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個主張是中國生成本土現代性的相輔相成的進路。
這兩個方面是相輔相成的。

sentences.english: To administer by morals and administer by law are complementary.
sentences.chinese: 德治與法治從來都是相輔相成的，二者缺一不可。

sentences.english: Good leadership and good decision-making go hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 卓越的領導力和優秀的決策能力相輔相成。

sentences.english: Bilateral dialogue and multilateral talks can complement and reinforce each other.
sentences.chinese: 雙邊對話與多邊會談可以相輔相成，相互促進。

sentences.english: The three complement each other, no one who can not go without.
sentences.chinese: 這三人相輔相成，誰也不能少掉誰。

sentences.english: The vicissitude of the Jing river and human activities complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 涇河變遷與人類活動是相輔相成的。

sentences.english: Data statistics and customers' survey are complementary and indespensable.
sentences.chinese: 數據統計跟用戶調研是相輔相成的，缺一不可。

sentences.english: Morality and law are related with each other.
sentences.chinese: 德與法是治國之二柄，兩者相輔相成，缺一不可。

sentences.english: Cultural tourism and Guan Gong culture in Yuncheng area is inseparably interconnected.
sentences.chinese: 運城地區的文化旅遊與關公文化是相輔相成的。

sentences.english: Simplicity and complexity need each other.
Peace and development complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 和平與發展是相輔相成的。

sentences.english: Health and beauty cannot be separated from each other.
sentences.chinese: 健康和美麗是相輔相成，密不可分的。

sentences.english: Translation and foreign language teaching are closely related and facilitate each other, but they have their own characteristics respectively.
sentences.chinese: 翻譯和外語教學既相輔相成，又各有其獨特的特點。

sentences.english: Therefore, Europeanization is closely related with literal translation.
sentences.chinese: 而直譯與“歐化”正相輔相成。

sentences.english: Discipline and love should be complementary to each other.
sentences.chinese: 訓誡和愛應該是相輔相成的。

definition: profitable to both sides/a win-win situation
to display/to exhibit/to bring out implicit or innate qualities/to express (a thought or moral)/to develop (an idea)/to elaborate (on a theme)
variant of 連接|连接[lian2 jie1]
to attend simultaneously to two or more things/to balance (career and family, family and education etc)
